title: Reinforcement Learning

definitions.Markov decision process: A set of states s in S, a set of actions (per state) A, a model T(s,a,s'), a reward function R(s,a,s')
definitions.Policy: Still looking for a policy π(s)

summary: The slide discusses Reinforcement Learning, focusing on the Markov decision process (MDP) which includes a set of states, actions, a model, and a reward function. It also mentions the ongoing search for a policy π(s). A diagram illustrates the process with a car's temperature states and actions, showing the impact of different actions on the car's temperature.
